35896841.review:
This is a fantastic VR game, and a great Tower Defense game!  

Today a lot of VR Games are still broderline demos or prototypes of VR Capabilities.  Castle Must Be Mine blew me away in that it brought to life all of the great needs of a TD game -- Slowly easing you into a state of confidence before it unleashes overwhelming hordes and multiple paths to your doom.  But then there are also other fantastic adds you can only get with VR!  Like teleporting yourself atop your castle and raining boulders upon your foes as you phsyically throw them off the edge.  Truly an excellent execution. 

As for VR - this is hands down one of the best out there.  Its not just a preview of what other developers could do if they put their minds to it, this IS what they can do.  Graphically, youre not picking up an oscar winning, cut-scene filled 4k masterpeice here... But you dont need any of that.  You need great intuitive VR controls, fun gameplay mechanics and a pace that keeps you on your toes, smiling the whole time.

This game nailed that for me.    If you're buying VR games, this need to be in your quivver.

35450957.review:
開発途中とのことですが、現在12ＭＡＰほどありやり応えが十分です。
すごく楽しんでます。

ゲーム目的は、「攻めてくる敵を、塔とナイト＋αで攻撃して城の中に入れない」という単純なものです。

ゲーム操作としては、下記のことが出来ます。
・３種類の塔（弓・大砲・魔法）を設置する。
・ナイト一人を移動させる。
　※塔とナイトは自動攻撃。
・敵を倒すとコインが出てくるので拾う。
・ためたコインで、塔を作ったり、塔のレベルを上げたりする。
・自分で投石が出来る。
　※MAPにより、投石の種類が異なる。
・４面以降で、城からも攻撃が可能。
　※城からの攻撃中は、それ以外の操作が出来ないので、素早い移動が必要。

システム面では、下記のことが出来ます。
・背の高さにあわせて、テーブルの高さを変えられる。
・テーブルの横にボタンがあり、「Quit」や「Restart」などが出来る。

良かったこと。
・塔を立てた後も、ただ見ているのではなく、投石したり、ナイトを移動させたり、コイン集めたりと楽しい。
・いかにしてナイトのレベルを上げるかを考えるのが楽しい。
・クリアー時の花火が、VR画面で見ると綺麗だった。
・HTC Viveのルームスケールだと、自分の足で右左に移動しながら操作できるので、最初のポジショニングだけコントローラでワープして決めれば、ほとんどワープは使用しないのでゲームに集中できてよかった。

気になったこと。
・テーブル以外の部屋構造がシンプルすぎ。
・ナイト弱すぎ、回復魔法かアイテムがあれば・・・。
・ホワイトボードに書かれている操作方法は、読めなくても、まぁなんとかなります。

35141450.review:
Not just an incredible tower defense game, an incredible VR game. 

Heat-of-the-moment tower defense works when there are just enough (or maybe slightly too many) tasks to keep track of, and this title strikes that balance well - with VR in mind. The use of clear audio cues, the act of collecting money, tower layouts/spacing, the micromanagement of the hero, the varied manual defense options on the top of the castle; all of these things make you forget about VR and simply concentrate on managing the virtual table. Suberb!

The only issue I could possibly bring up with this game is the user experience on Oculus. I have both Rift and Vive, and room scale Vive is by far the superior experience. A seated or standing Rift experience requires quite a bit of turning and positioning. The teleport mechanic is clunky in the heat of battle, and the buttons used to turn are the same buttons that sell towers - I have accidentally sold a tower more than once. I know that Rift support is new, I expect it will get better with time.

If I were to make a list right now of the best VR games all time, this one is top 5 for sure.

32832201.review:
Tower Defense Spiele eignen sich anscheinend wirklich gut für VR und CMBM ist ein recht guter Vertreter in dieser Kategorie.
Es gibt dabei ja unterschiedliche Arten von Tower Defense Spielen. In einigen baut man labyrinte aus billigen Türmen, in anderen - wie hier - hat man vorgegebene Bauplätze und man muss sich entscheiden welche Sorte Tum man dort hin baut.

CMBM ist definitiv von der sehr guten Kingdom Rush Serie inspiriert und wer diese mag, wird sich heir wieder finden. Die bereits Spielbaren Karten sind ganz gut durchdacht und nach kurzer Zeit auch recht fordernd.

Das Spiel ist noch im Early Access und es fehlen defintiv noch einige wichtige Teile. Das Entwicklerteam (bestehend aus nur zwei Personen) reicht aber regelmäßig Updates ein und vergrößert den Umfang. Die Spielmechanik funktioniert im Kern dabei bereits extrem gut, so dass man viel Spaß am Spiel hat.

Man benötigt eine Spielfläche von etwa 1,5*2m damit man auch einmal sinnvoll um den Tisch herum gehen kann, auch wenn man theoretisch in einem kleineren Bereich stehen bleiben kann, ist es besser, wenn man das Feld mal schnell aus einem anderen Winkel betrachten kann.

Für ein Early Access Spiel ist CMBM in einem extrem gut spielbaren und vom Kern her absolut richtig gemachten Zustand. Regelmäßige Updates und leidenschaftliche Entwickler - da kann ich das Spiel im Moment absolut empfehlen.

31993976.review:
Credo di aver giocato tutti gli strategici, a turni o in tempo reale, presenti per realtà virtuale e magari non in early access, che a tutt'oggi (un anno fa le cose erano ben diverse) sono parecchi e anche di ottima fattura. Castle Must Be Mine arriva nella mia libreria per ultimo per la sua lunga gestazione early access, dato che non amo comprare giochi finiti a metà e di questo strumento si è sfortunatamente abusato, almeno per ciò che riguarda il VR, creando spiacevoli effetti e titoli che giacciono in stato di abbandono.

Il gioco, lo dico subito, è delizioso. Sebbene dal punto di vista della realizzazione tecnica e del budget non sia alla pari dei più coreografici Tethered o Siegecraft Commander, Castle Must Be Mine usa la realtà virtuale ma soprattutto le possibilità del roomscale e dell'handtracking (ovvero camminare e afferrare le cose) meglio di qualsiasi altro strategico. Questo splendido risultato lo si è ottenuto pensando fin dalla sua genesi il titolo come un gioco da tavolo, infatti lo scenario di battaglia è proprio un tavolo di dimensioni analoge ad uno di biliardo. Non solo: l'intera mappa di gioco è concepita per essere efficacemente utilizzata stando da un lato specifico del tavolo, quindi anche senza avere spazi enormi (e senza necessita di un tracking a 360 gradi) si ha assolutamente l'impressione di giocare di fronte ad un meraviglioso plastico con cannoni e piccoli soldati poligonali.

L'eccellente concezione del gioco come titolo per realtà virtuale la si evince anche dall'interfaccia. Non serve alcun tipo di spiegazione per giocare, si usano due bottoni (la cui funzione è raffigurata nel controller) e praticamente ogni operazione è un oggetto fisico da toccare. Non solo: a parte l'azione tower defence, ci sono geniali contenuti addizionali che aumentano ancora di più il coinvolgimento. Si possono lanciare palle di fuoco, prendendole dallo scenario e lanciandole con le proprie mani, o immergerci occasionalmente nella prospettiva del gioco entrando nel castello per tirare i massi a due mani contro l'esercito invasore. Non manca anche un "eroe" da usare come difesa mobile, da piazzare nella mappa con tanto di energia e punti esperienza.

Dopo esserci sincerati sulla bontà ed ergonomia del gioco, vediamo i contenuti. Trattasi di un classico tower defence, dove le regole di gioco sono assai semplificate, ma il livello di difficoltà è invece solido. E' sempre difficile gestire difficoltà e frustrazione: per esempio Evil Robot Traffic Jam, analogo tower defence per VR, è ben fatto ma eccede nella difficoltà risultando presto poco interessante. Qui ci sono invece dei livelli "cuscinetto" dove si può vincere con un basso livello di strategia, ma da un certo punto in poi i nemici saranno semplicemente troppi, e servirà spendere i vostri crediti con la massima ponderazione per massimizzare il danno.

Il prezzo riflette il livello della realizzazione, è un gioco fatto da un piccolo team, con assets poligonali carini ma semplici ed una qualità tipicamente indie. L'eventuale amante del dettaglio può storcere il naso nei primi minuti, ma dopo poco se vi piace il genere è davvero difficile farci caso, il gioco è troppo ben congegnato e passerete il vostro tempo a spostare l'eroe, erigere fortificazioni e lanciare palle infuocate. Un esempio per tutti gli strategici nell'uso del VR.

30690100.review:
I'm a big fan of tower defence. As a result I like this game, and I think it's a pretty good start for VR tower defence. But, if I have to be honest, as a tower defence - it's really quite rudimentry. There are only 3 tower types (arrow, magic, and cannon). The balance between the towers seems to be strange also [spoiler](cannon towers seem quite underpowered compared to the others, usually the mission goes better if you ignore them or only build 1)[/spoiler]. You also have a hero which can draw aggro of a single enemy to keep them from advancing. There is also a spell that can be cast such as a tornado or a fireball. And finally, the castle itself usually has some sort of defence of last resort (such as boulders or a cannon), with limited ammo.

The draw of this game is that there are moments when things get pretty hectic. The player will be building towers, casting spells, managing their hero, and occasionally jumping into their tower to use their weapon of last resort.

It's fun, but it is somewhat limited in strategy and does get a little repetitive.

I think the devs should put in more tower types, such as flame towers that hit in a line, or lightning towers that can chain attacks, and frost towers that can slow. Maybe implement temporary powerups for towers. Additional hero types, or powers would also be useful so that there are different ways of defeating each level. Something to give this game more complexity and replayability, is really what I think this game needs.

Otherwise, currently this is a decent start for VR tower defence, but a mediocre tower defence at best.

29220441.review:
I enjoyed it, definitely worth the price of admission.  While still early access, the base mechanics are sound, while leaving room for new features in the future.  In addition to placing towers, a major gameplay mechanic is moving the knight character around. He will engage one creature at a time, locking it in place to allow your towers to shoot at it for longer. 
You also get a fireball/meteor spell attack that recharges, and later levels give you a limited supply of boulders to chuck down at enemies closing in on your castle.  I found the boulders to be fairly underwhelming considering the limited supply you get, but they do push enemies back if you just need a few extra seconds for your towers to whittle them down, so they can be useful. The fireball/meteor is fun, although its damage seems pretty paltry. I am also a rather terrible shot with it, so I wouldn't mind some sort of aiming reticle or texture on the ground to show where the attack will hit, but I could also just "get gud" and aim better.
There are multiple enemy types, especially by the last currently available level.  You've got fast guys, slow guys, guys who take less damage from magic, all sorts of things.  Good variety.  Oh, and a boss-type that will seriously mess your knight up if you don't micro him around.
Anyway, if you've got a VR headset, and you like tower defense games, pick this up. Cheaper than going to the movies, and with the promise of more content on the way, it will give you hours of fun.

27079083.review:
I bought this because I got frustrated watching ownedbytamater play it. I think the controls are fairly obvious, though the icon for the magic tower looks like a bow and arrow to me. The main mechanic that sets this apart as a tower defense game is the soldier you control that can be used to engage the enemies and either clump them up or string them out, depending on your choice of cannons vs magic (magic seems to be strongest atm). Everytime you pick him up and drop him next to an enemy, he takes a swing at the enemy and the enemy stops and attacks back. If you leave him be, he'll continue to fight that one enemy with an attack every few seconds. If you pick him back up and drop him right away, he'll take another swing without waiting. Maybe it's exploity, but it feels intentional because you get to micromanage this one guy while the towers run on autopilot. Also he gets XP every time he hits, so spamming the hits really helps later on.

Also there are fireballs you can pick up and throw at the enemies. It takes a while to recharge, but you hear when it does so it doesn't sit there going to waste.

If you like tower defense games, this is a worthwhile VR adaptation of the genre. My one gripe is it's too easy to accidentally build an archery tower when you're trying to pick your guy up.

26744134.review:
今日VR 游戏测评组 西埋埋

有多少人喜欢玩塔防类游戏，举个手，也算埋埋一个。塔防类游戏作为经典的游戏类型，到现在还在不断推陈出新。《植物大战僵尸》、《保卫萝卜》这些游戏，几乎所有人老老少少都接触过。

今天评测的这款游戏《Castle Must Be Mine》就是VR版本的塔防游戏，需要建造炮台、魔法石、弓箭来抵抗魔物入侵。

VR版玩法略有突破
塔防的玩法好像本身就舍弃掉了VR沉浸感的特性。于是玩家就被设定在了一个娱乐室，房间的中间有个很大的桌子，这个就是本体游戏的舞台了。

到了第四关之后，玩家就可以直接站上城门对楼底的漏网之鱼砸巨石。这个部分是第一人称视角，所以当我站上城门的时候还是觉得挺兴奋的。

开发者显然游戏考虑到了VR版本应与普通手机、PC上有所区别，才想出了这个玩法。但就单单这一个适应VR的点或许有这么一点点的简陋。既然能上城楼那我也想进入炮塔、弓箭塔来自己射射箭呀，开开炮呀。

除此之外，游戏有了能由玩家直接控制的火球和一名勇者大人。虽然火球有CD时间，但是勇者大人就是个眼瞎的肉盾啊！在他帮忙拖时间的时候用力地砸下火球，是不是有种天降正义的感觉（不）

游戏内容多但流程短
游戏中魔物的种类还是比较多的，粗略算了下至少有7，8种。而且每个魔物都有自己的特征和血量。比如这个龙，伤害高血又厚，勇者大人在他面前可有点力不从心。

炮台、魔法石等机关也可以升级到3级，勇者自动升级。不过到后面的关卡，我们的勇者大人似乎有点招架不住。

目前游戏只有5关，要想全部通关还是挺快的。擅长塔防游戏的话一个小时基本能通关，可是对于在第四关就死掉的玩家朋友们，可能要多花点时间挑战哦。

不过除了目前这块土地之外，旁边还有一块猩红色的土地。应该是开发组未完成的土地，到时候就期待后续的关卡和创新。

综评
从建模到玩法，这确实是一个完整的游戏。目前Steam上售价为28元，这个价格来玩一个仅有5关的游戏有些不那么划算。想要入手的朋友们也可以等后续关卡的更新哦。当然啦，喜欢塔防类游戏的朋友也可以来玩一玩，毕竟难度系数还是挺大的。

This game was a lot more fun then I was expecting. I'm a huge fan of Kittypocalypse which set the bar pretty high but this game has its own perks which I really enjoyed that set it apart. 

The movement and controls in this game are extremely simple. You can pretty much access the entire table standing in one position the whole time; but it is fun to walk around during the waves and look closer at the guys fighting and stuff. I like the little hero dude you can control, he is a neat addition to this type of game which you can move around and use to play crowd control as needed. The three tower types keep things simple and are upgradable later on. There's also a fireball thing you can chuck at guys that spawns on a magic tower which I REALLY enjoyed. After its used another one spawns on a timer; it comes with maps automatically after level 1 so no need to spend extra moneys for it. The big rock that you throw with two hands I was really suprised to see and I had a BLAST chucking it off the castle wall at the bad guys. I could totally see this game being a hit maybe for kids or anyone that finds Kittypocalypse too complicated. 
 
One thing I would like to see is more tower types like maybe a catapult that launches a rock and does good AOE damage with a long range (I've only made it through the first 3 or 4 levels so it's possible they come later in game?). I also think it would be great if you could control the little hero dude in first person view like you can in Out Of Ammo. :) Also, I think it would be cool if there was an animation that went with hero when you pick him up to move him (like he sits there wiggling around while your holding him by his helmet or something.)

There are a lot of early access VR games out that cost more than they are worth at the time of release. I think they did a great job pricing this game at release and would recommend people try it out.

26627804.review:
《城堡一定是我的》是近日在steam上发售的一款VR塔防游戏。在VR游戏中，塔防游戏的数量不少，但大多都只是延续了传统塔防游戏的套路，VR化之后也不过是将视角变得更加丰富、并给予玩家一个相对独立的空间来思考策略。
而我们今天给大家介绍的这款塔防游戏注重的是玩家的“参与”和“互动”，让玩家与防御塔一起抵御敌人的进攻，以此来增加游戏的沉浸感。那么就跟着我们一起来看一看这款游戏吧。
游戏的玩法很简单，在游戏已经给出的基座上建立各种各样的防御塔来击杀怪物，防止它们入侵城堡。不同的怪物拥有不同的血量、移动速度，玩家需要根据地形、防御塔的性质来布局，确保将敌人全部消灭。
这是我们目前为止，见到的唯一一款玩家需要切身参与其中的塔防游戏。游戏中玩家需要使用运动控制定位器进行各种各样的操作，甚至需要爬上城墙，弯腰用双手举起巨石砸向那些怪物们，阻拦它们的前进。
这款游戏中，除了防御塔，还有一个英雄的角色，它负责守卫城门，当然玩家也可以将它放到地图上的任何一个位置，它会拦截与它最近的一个敌人，与其战斗。这个角色是有血量的，当其死亡之后会变成一个小小的墓碑，在十几秒之后重新站起来投入战斗。
玩家可以操控的变量有很多，这个英雄角色的位置需要玩家来调整，小怪们死亡之后的金币需要玩家收集，还需要观察自己目前的金币数量，升级建造防御塔。
除了这些，游戏中还有一座小小的火山，火山的上空漂浮着一个光华流转的圆球，玩家可以抓取这个圆球，丢向怪物，造成群体范围伤害。这个圆球每隔一段时间刷新一次，一局游戏下来可以投掷许多次，算是这款游戏中比较重要的一个玩点。
玩家在游戏中需要操作的部分很多，但游戏的节奏控制的很好，让玩家的动作虽然紧张，但却不会手忙脚乱。
这款游戏与传统塔防游戏最大的区别就是，让玩家不再仅仅只再“看”着整个游戏的进行，而是开发出了各种各样的互动元素让玩家参与到塔防之中，这样的做法很有新意，也十分成功。
游戏的操作比较特别，例如建造防御塔的时候，玩家需要先将手柄碰触到游戏预设给玩家的塔位上，才能进行下一步操作。在选择要建造的防御塔时，玩家需要按压圆盘上的相应部位，当相应的防御塔虚影显示在玩家面前时按下扳机键开始建造。
游戏的地图比较大，加上游戏中玩家需要做出各种各样的动作，玩家在现实中的游玩空间不够大的话，很容易撞到墙壁，所以在这里我们建议玩家使用手柄圆盘的瞬移功能。
但是问题也随之而来，建造塔的时候，要是不小心将手挪开预设的塔位，就很容易进行莫名其妙的瞬移。加上游戏的地图很大，玩家的手并不能很轻松的触及整个地图，必须时常走动瞬移，这个方面的操作比较繁琐，算是一个小小的缺点。
游戏中的防御塔共有3种，不算特别多，分别是弓箭塔、魔法塔和炮塔。
弓箭塔和魔法塔都是单攻炮塔，只不过弓箭塔的攻速较快，适合应付速度型的敌人，魔法塔的攻击力很高，适合应对大型怪物。弓箭塔是建造价格最低、性价比相对较高的一种防御塔，游戏前期玩家没有太多金钱储备的情况下可以利用弓箭塔们来积累金币，多建造几座弓箭塔也有利于拦截速度型的敌人。
而炮塔，是唯一的一个群体攻击型防御塔，它射速较慢，输出高，一砸就是一小片，建议玩家将它建造在分岔路口这种容易聚集怪物的地方，以发挥它最大的作用。
游戏中的英雄角色也可以与防御塔配合使用，让它待在路口拦截怪物们，多少会造成一些单位体积的碰撞，这个时候就可以让一边的炮台轰个痛快了。
游戏的画面采用的是像素风格，简约而不简单。虽然整个场景地图建模乃至于怪物们的模型看起来都是棱棱角角，有着几分的粗糙，但是细看之下会发现其实贴图十分细致，物理效果极好，棱角的每一面还在折射着不同的光彩。
另外，每一种怪物在跑动的时候都有其独特的姿势，而当它们死亡的时候都会有不同死亡特效。例如蜘蛛怪在死亡的时候会整只反过来，抽搐几下它的小脚们，足见制作方对于这方面的细致。
音效方面则没有什么特别的地方，每一次攻击、进攻都有不同的音效，并且合理到位。背景音乐更是采用了比较激烈、具有节奏感的音乐，给玩家制造一种比较紧张的战斗氛围。
如此身临其境的游戏体验，我们还是第一次在VR塔防游戏中感受到，这是一次很成功的VR化尝试。目前游戏还有尚未开放的关卡，相信在接下来的更新中制作方会为我们带来能更加丰富、出色的内容，推荐玩家们购买体验。
http://www.83830.com/game/201611/155112072_1.shtml

26581718.review:
2017年1月25日更新：

新增了4张新地图，很多新怪兽，还有两个新武器（新地图中的龙卷风取代了火球、火炮取代了巨石），炮台能够升级的最高等级也提高了。一如既往地好玩！

新地图很大，怪兽也多了，难度自然更高了。我估计游玩空间如果太小的话，玩起来难度会更高，虽然游戏中能够瞬移，但是由于这游戏节奏很快，几乎全程都在忙个不停，游玩空间小的话，瞬移会浪费时间。所以，我还是建议开发商采用类似Kittypocalypse的拖动地图的方式，这样更方便快速。

——————————————————

真是没想到这个这么便宜的游戏这么好玩，差点错过一款好游戏，貌似还是国产的？

这款塔防游戏很好地利用了VR的特性。现在的VR塔防游戏，要么是全部第三人称，上帝视角控制；要么就是第三人称为主，可以切换到第一人称参与作战，其实结合的不是很好，有点为了VR应付性地添加第一人称一样，撇除第一人称也不会太影响游戏性。

在这款游戏里，你也是上帝视角，但你不用切换到第一人称就能参战，用控制器收集金币、扔火球等，到了第四关，你还能切换到城楼场景（算是切换到第一人称），扔石头砸敌人。所以，这款塔防VR游戏比起其他的塔防游戏更忙，因为基本上你时刻都在作战状态。细节也还做得不错，我仔细看了一下敌人，都做得还蛮有特色的，赢了后还会得瑟。目前有5个地图，还有5个地图在开发中，期待更多地玩法！

很高兴开发者接受了大家的意见，以下缺点已经改善：

缺点就是，操作上有改进空间。比如，退出等菜单设置放在桌边上，我刚开始玩时没留意到，连玩了两次，都一不小心退出去了，我还以为是游戏问题，后来才发现是碰到退出键了，点了退出后是直接退出，没点提示，所以这个最起码是要给个确认键。还有就是地图比较大，需要用圆盘瞬移来移动，由于建造塔防设施也是用圆盘，经常会点到建造塔，而且一不小心就瞬移到地图很远的地方。建议采用控制器侧键拖动的方式来移动和调节地图高度（可以参考Kittypocalypse），这样更方便，正好这个键目前也没利用起来，或者只能其中一个圆盘瞬移。

39109270.review:
TLDR: Frustratingly oversimplistic and under developed mechanics as far as tower defense games go these days. It also is lacking in diversity and content, and an extraordinarily weak value for the price they are asking.

I thought I'd have a great time playing this as I was once a big fan of tower defense games. However the developers seem to have discarded what every other tower defense game has figured out over the multitude of years they've been around. Overall the game is overly simplistic and fails to offer features and mechanics that even the simplest of modern tower defense games have offered for some time. The novelty of playing a tower defense game in VR is not enough to keep me playing or recommend this to anyone. I would REALLY like to see this game's mechanics reworked and updated, but for now I'm going to refund it as it's clearly not worth the price tag as it stands at the time of this review ($17 CAD, or ~$13.49 USD). 
In it's current state the game only features a few towers and they act very similar to each other besides range, minor AOE damage, and a mediocre system where enemies can resist certain types of damage. This lack of diversity shows very early in the game when you discover that there's little point in strategizing too much other than blocking enemies from moving with the knight while they're surrounded by towers. I find it hard to understand why the developers have not chosen to implement most of the strategic features of more robust tower defense games, which can feature over 20 unique towers with branching upgrade paths for example. There's not enough diversity in tower mechanics in order to combine tower effects to create synergies. 
Though it appears to be a simple game to manage with such a small learning curve and small variety of towers, on certain levels it's seemingly impossible to stop larger enemies after maximizing the fields damage output through upgrades, strategic tower placement and choke points, constant micromanagement of the field knight, and well timed and aimed player spells/powers. I also thought that the over-the-head rock throwing from the castle wall was a cool experience, but it didn't fit well with the strategic style of a tower defense game and took away critical amounts of time that I would rather have spent planning out my strategy. I appreciated the efforts to involve the player in the defense but I don't think it's as valuable an addition to the gameplay as tower variety or expanded automation options could be. It doesn't help when the game more or less forces you to use the rock and other player controlled powers as your towers quickly become overwhelmed at points despite careful management of gold and resources. Even the act of having to reach out and collect the gold from fallen enemies becomes more of a tedium than a rewarding experience, just another thing to micromanage. 
The menus in game are also inconvenient to use and lacking options and customization. The menu is found at the side of the field/table and, merely by virtue of it's placement there precludes the convenient addition of more options in the future such as volume sliders, graphics options, tower targeting preferences, automation and managment settings, etc. A related issue I see is the knight character. I would prefer it to target the enemy that's furthest along the path but instead attacks whatever is closest to him making many enemies slip by even when he's placed as close to the castle door as possible (settings for the player to choose that would be nice). On top of that the knight will freely walk around and away from where ever you last placed him requiring more adjustment to his positioning. 
To summarize I had a very frustrating experience playing this but I can see the potential this game has for development and expansion. I would repurchase and recommend this game if the developers were to fulfill this potential.
